content.description: Only really a good warmup climb.
content.location: Stand start on the sloping corner platform. Top-out straight up.

content.description: A fun short climb, worth the time to get on it.
content.location: Start on the two handed crimp rail at chest height. Make a big move to obvious sloper below the lip. Mantle over the top.

content.description: Solid fun climb with a project variation that is quite hard.
content.location: Stand-start using horizontal crack at head height. Top out straight above. The arête to the left is out. Variation A - Project: Sit-start five feet right of “Fistfull of Something” and climb into “Fistfull of Something”.

content.description: Another easy climb, it fund but should be treated with care.
content.location: Sit-start using the right gaining crack. Climb up the slab to the top.

content.description: A fantastic quality V3 that should definitely be given a go!
content.location: Sit-start on the pinch and sloper at chest height. Climb into the horizontal crack and move right to top-out. The left wall is out. Variation A - V4: Sit-start at the base of the overhanging arête on the side pull two feet up (right hand) and side pull three feet up (left hand). Climb into the top-out of “E-Break”.

content.description: Fun climb for warming up too. A lot of features so it is a straightforward climb.
content.location: Sit-start with both hands on positive crimps at chest height. Climb up the featured face to the jug rail near the top.

content.description: This is a fun warmup, not the best climb on the boulder, tread lightly too.
content.location: Stand-start to the left of the arête and and follow holds up and left to the top. Variation A - V1: Start as “Consensual Complacency” and climb up the left side of the arête. Variation B - V1: Start as “DP for Mayor” and finish as “Consensual Complacency”.

content.description: Quality 2 that should be given a try.
content.location: Sit-start using the right-rising side pull left of the arête. Climb up the left side of the face using the arête and face holds, then bust to the jug rail.

content.description: Solid climb, should try it if your warming up.
content.location: Start at “DP for Mayor” and climb into the top-out of “Stuah-bewwy”.

content.description: An erratic with a couple of quality climbs. Probably the best boulder out of the all of the in the Near East. Go to the guidebook to get more comprehensive info on the climbing at this link. There are detailed topo's in it, so use that instead of MP.
